div.p: John Hawks was looking for ways to gamify education. [tweet]

ul.li: Offer 'virtual currency' for doing things that don't (directly) earn students a better grade. For example, such as reading certain extra books or extra academic papers you provide a list for.
Allow virtual currency to be used to increase a student's score on assignments and (possibly also) exams. (Of course, you'd need a way to verify those extra activities were completed.)
Also could post list of the "top 5" people for each test and assignment, online somewhere (that would be permanent). Students may see it as a "soft" recommendation from you.

Also, giving users (virtual) badges for completing tasks (or whatever), and if the student opts-in, then make those (virtual) badges publicly and permanently viewable online, so that a student can have it be used as another proxy for quality (in addition to their degree). (Something that can be helpful for a student's career.)
